Considering the day and time
column2: seating was quite available and there was no waiting. We ordered a couple of glasses of wine and reviewed the menu. Our server and staff we always prompt and attentive.

column2: a crab curry dish (Sen Mee Kang Pou)

column4: crispy and not greasy at all
column5: and the fish was moist and tender. Crab Curry was LOADED with pieces of real crab meat and has a smooth sweet open with a very spicy finish. The pork had a nice char
column6: but again

column1: ATMOSPHERE -
Chada Thai is a very small restaurant
column2: so the space can feel a bit cramped and claustrophobic. With that in mind

column5: which for me is such a no no
column6: but enough individual tables that you don't feel like your sitting in your neighbors lap.

column1: All and all
column2: the food is truly the star here and carries the establishment all the way to a top rating!! THIS PLACE IS A MUST!!"'2'bc8C_eETBWL0olvFSJJd0w

column10: he wrote the president of the United States! His request was denied.

column1: Supposedly
column2: Frank's ashes were scattered on the Taliesin West property
column3: after his third wife had unknown accomplices haphazardly exhume Frank's body from his grave back in Spring Green. It is also said that these grave diggers may not have gotten all of Frank and that one of his feet was left in Wisconsin (at least that's what our WI tour guide told us!).

column1: So
column2: the verdict is
column3: if you have even an inkling of interest in Frank Lloyd Wright
column4: take the tour. Any tour. At the very least
column5: stop in at the gift shop and pick up a book on the man; you can always come back.
